name: Stuffed Pickle Egg Rolls
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: Crab salad meets crab rangoon in these stuffed fried pickles.
ingredients: ½ teaspoon seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
directions: Combine crabmeat, cream cheese, celery, green onion, Worcestershire sauce, and seafood seasoning in a mixing bowl
Use a spoon to scoop out and discard the seeds from each pickle half to create 16 boats
Spoon a tablespoon of cream cheese mixture into one pickle boat and top with the the other half of the pickle to seal
Repeat with remaining pickles and cream cheese mixture
Place an egg roll wrapper on a clean surface in diamond shape with one corner facing you
Fold up bottom half of wrapper and tightly fold in sides
Gently roll and seal with a couple drops of water
Repeat with remaining wrappers and pickles
Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place 4 egg rolls in the hot oil and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes
Remove egg rolls using tongs and place on a paper towel-lined plate
